articles.title: UPDATE 1-Argentina central bank to ease financing for drought-hit farm sector
articles.description: (Adds context, comment from bank)By Walter BianchiBUENOS AIRES, Feb 2 (Reuters) - Argentina's central bank will adopt measures to ease financing for the country's key grains sector that has been badly hit by drought, the entity said on Thursday, which will include more flexible terms on non-payment and subsidized credit lines.The measures will ease rules until Dec.

articles.title: Argentina OKs new 2,000 peso bill as inflation bites, still only worth $5
articles.description: Argentina will roll out a new 2,000-peso bill, the central bank said on Thursday, which would double the face value of the country's top denomination bank note, but would still only be worth $11 officially and $5 in commonly used parallel markets.
articles.content: BUENOS AIRES, Feb 2 (Reuters) - Argentina will roll out a new 2,000-peso bill, the central bank said on Thursday, which would double the face value of the country's top denomination bank note, but would still only be worth $11 officially and $5 in co... [1513 chars]

articles.title: Packer eyes Argentina energy, mining investment
articles.description: The billionaire is flush with cash and met late last year with local businessmen and politicians including Economy Minister Sergio Massa.
articles.content:
James Packer is considering an investment in Argentina’s energy or mining sectors, according to people familiar with the matter.
Packer explored investment options during a dinner late last year at a racetrack in Buenos Aires with businessmen and pol... [742 chars]

articles.title: World Cup winner Raphael Varane retires from France team
articles.description: France defender Raphal Varane announced his retirement from the national team on Thursday, the second major player to leave Les Bleus following the World Cup final defeat to Argentina.The 29-year-old Varane made his debut 10 years ago and played 93 times.
articles.content:
France defender Raphaël Varane announced his retirement from the national team on Thursday, the second major player to leave Les Bleus following the World Cup final defeat to Argentina.

articles.title: Space power China to build ground stations on Antarctica to support satellites
articles.description: The project was part of broader initiatives aimed at building China's marine economy and turning China into a marine power, according to China Space News. A Chinese-built ground station in Argentina's Patagonia has stirred concerns about its purpose despite China's assurance that the station's goal is peaceful space observation and spacecraft missions.
articles.content: China, only the third country to put a man in space after the Soviet Union and United States, is to build ground stations on Antarctica to back its network of ocean monitoring satellites, state media said on Thursday. China's global network of ground... [1877 chars]

articles.title: GRAINS-Soybeans tick higher on Argentine dry weather conditions
articles.description: SINGAPORE, Feb 2 (Reuters) - Chicago soybean futures edged up in early Asian trading on Wednesday, as dry weather conditions in top producer Argentina continued posing supply concerns.Wheat edged down, losing for a second consecutive session, while corn was largely unchanged.FUNDAMENTALS* The most-active soybean contract on the Chicago Board of Trade (CBOT) Sv1 gained 0.4% to
articles.content:

articles.title: Argentina's grain export revenue plunges in January, chamber says
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb 1 (Reuters) - Argentina's revenue from exports of grain, oilseeds and their derivatives plummeted 61% in January from a year ago, exporters and crushers chamber CIARA-CEC said on Wednesday, in a setback as the country tries to refill foreign currency reserves.Exports totaled $928.37 million in the first month of the year, also falling 75% over the previous
